intro: Dichaelia elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed dichaelia, is a member of the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, two-celled spikelets. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in wetland ecosystems.
